Package game

Class PlayerController

java.lang.Object
game.PlayerController
All Implemented Interfaces:
city.cs.engine.StepListener, KeyListener, MouseListener, EventListener
public class PlayerController extends Object implements city.cs.engine.StepListener, KeyListener, MouseListener
Controls a Player object in response to user inputs from the keyboard and mouse. This controller handles directional movement, jumping, and shooting based on key presses and mouse clicks. It also updates the player's state such as possessing a gun and controls the visual representation of the player depending on the current action (walking left/right, idling, jumping, and shooting).

This class implements KeyListener for handling keyboard events and MouseListener for handling mouse events to control player actions like movement and shooting.

Since:
1.0

    • PlayerController

      public PlayerController(Player player, float speed, float jumpImpulse)
      Constructs a PlayerController for the specified player with defined speed and jump impulse.
      Parameters:
      player - The player object to control.
      speed - The horizontal movement speed of the player.
      jumpImpulse - The vertical impulse for jumping.

    • keyPressed

      public void keyPressed(KeyEvent e)
      Responds to key press events to control the player. Handles the logic for starting the player's walking, jumping, and the direction facing based on key presses.
      Specified by:
      keyPressed in interface KeyListener
      Parameters:
      e - The KeyEvent containing the information about the key pressed.

    • keyReleased

      public void keyReleased(KeyEvent e)
      Responds to key release events to stop the player's movement or update the player's idle state. This method controls what happens when the player stops moving, such as stopping walking or updating the visual state to show the player holding a gun or idling.
      Specified by:
      keyReleased in interface KeyListener
      Parameters:
      e - The KeyEvent containing the information about the key released.

    • mouseClicked

      public void mouseClicked(MouseEvent e)
      Handles mouse click events to shoot bullets if the player has a gun. Creates and shoots a bullet in the direction the player is facing when the mouse button is clicked.
      Specified by:
      mouseClicked in interface MouseListener
      Parameters:
      e - The MouseEvent containing details about the mouse click.

    • updatePlayer

      public void updatePlayer(Player newPlayer)
      Updates the Player object being controlled. This method allows for changing the player object controlled by the controller, useful when changing levels or players in the game.
      Parameters:
      newPlayer - The new player object to control.
